means: 使根深蒂固(ingrain的过去分词形式)

sentence.Network_en: From ingrained habit he paused to straighten up the bed.
sentence.Network_cn: 出于长期的习惯，他停下来整理床铺。

sentence.Network_en: The associative guilt was ingrained in his soul.
sentence.Network_cn: 由此产生的内疚感在他灵魂深处挥之不去。

sentence.Network_en: The belief that one should work hard is ingrained in our culture.
sentence.Network_cn: 人人都应该努力工作这个信念在我们的文化中根深蒂固.

entry.tran: 根深蒂固的;难以根除的
entry.def: Ingrained habits and beliefs are difficult to change or remove.

example.ex: Morals tend to be deeply ingrained...
example.tran: 道德观念往往根深蒂固。

example.ex: From ingrained habit he paused to straighten up the bed.
example.tran: 出于长期的习惯,他停下来整理床铺。

means.word_mean: 1. (used especially of ideas or principles) deeply rooted; firmly fixed or held;

auth_sentence.content: But I guess that control-in-order-to-protect is ingrained in me.
auth_sentence.res_content: But I guess that control-in-order-to-protect is ingrained in me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But I guess that control-in-order-to-protect is ingrained in me.

auth_sentence.content: People have an ingrained need to have meaning and relevance.
auth_sentence.res_content: People have an ingrained need to have meaning and relevance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People have an ingrained need to have meaning and relevance.

auth_sentence.content: Ignorance is inexcusable and stupidity is ingrained.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ignorance is inexcusable and stupidity is ingrained.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ignorance is inexcusable and stupidity is ingrained.

means.word_mean: (指习惯、字迹等)牢固的, 极难除掉的

sentences.en: The belief that one should work hard is ingrained in our culture.
sentences.cn: 人人都应该努力工作这个信念在我们的文化中根深蒂固。
